measured_by: 5-item Eco-Guilt Scale (Mallett, 2012; adapted by Moore & Yang, 2020)
justification: "Eco-guilt was assessed on a 5-item measure originally developed by Mallett (2012) and adapted by Moore and Yang (2020)."

measured_by: 7-item Pro-Climate Civic Intentions questionnaire (donate, contact officials, sign petition, etc.)
justification: "We measured intention to engage in seven pro-climate civic actions in the next year… These measures aimed to capture spillover effects to civic climate actions beyond individual actions (Cronbach's alpha = 0.90)."
"We measured perceived mitigation responsibilities for various groups of people and organizations (see SI.1 part 7)."

measured_by: Single-item self-assessment of climate concern (Swim & Geiger, 2017)
justification: "Most people… identified as either concerned or alarmed about climate change on Swim and Geiger's (2017) single-item self-assessment of climate concern."
"We additionally measured climate worry on a 5-point scale (1 = not at all worried … 5 = very worried) as this was a more sensitive measure in pilot studies."

measured_by: Personal Carbon Calculator difference (ΔCO2e between 2019 and 2023)
justification: "Change in carbon footprint (ΔCO2e)… calculated as 2023 intended carbon footprint minus 2019 reported carbon footprint" using the personal carbon calculator questions.

measured_by: Real money allocation slider for $0–$100 carbon offsets
justification: "Participants… indicated how much of $100 they would like to allocate to carbon offsets… This was a real behavioral measure of climate action."
